_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: NodeJS v14 (V2.0)
author: support@oxide.host
description: Oxide Hosting - Pterodactyl Egg: Discord Bot Hosting - NodeJS v14, version 2.0 (updated: 19th February 2021, only to be used on internal servers - services provided by Oxide Hosting). Please note support will not be provided for these eggs.

variables.name: Startup File Name
variables.description: Please input the startup file name of your Discord Bot (including the file extension .js at the end of the file name).

variables.name: Additional NPM Modules
variables.description: Please input any additional NPM modules your Discord Bot may require (using the following format as an example: opusscript ytdl-core), list all modules separated by a space; if you use this input, 'package.json' will not be used to install modules.

variables.name: Automatic Package Update/Installation
variables.description: Please input whether you wish to auto-install/update modules listed within the file 'package.json' or within the 'Additional NPM Modules' variable (true or false may be entered). This will also disable/enable Git support and an auto-updater for NPM.

variables.name: GitHub Repository
variables.description: Please input the GitHub repository name from which will be used to fetch your Discord Bot. Please leave this empty if you do not wish to use this option, if your repository is private; please ensure to specify your username and access token.

variables.name: GitHub Repository Username
variables.description: Please input the username of the owner of the repository, this may be the same as your username if you created the repository; this is required for both public and private repositories.

variables.name: GitHub Private Repository Username
variables.description: Please input your GitHub username in order to access a private repository, you may leave this empty for public repositories.

variables.name: GitHub Private Repository Authentication
variables.description: Please input your GitHub authentication token in order to access a private repository, you may leave this empty for public repositories. You must provide the 'repo' permissions to this authorisation token.
